00001 <h2>What&rsquo;s on TV now?</h2>
00002 <p class="centered">
00003         <img id="screenshot" style="margin: 10px"
00004                 src="/assets/images/software/widgets/guidatv/guidatv-screenshot-0.9.png"
00005                 alt="GuidaTV Widget" />
00006 </p>
00007 
00008 <p>
00009         GuidaTV is an Electronic Program Guide (EPG) widget for the Italian TV.
00010 </p>
00011 <p>
00012         Programs can be filtered by time slot, channel and program genre by using the controls on the back of the widget.
00013         New: it is now possible to perform a Spotlight-like research using the search field on the front.
00014 </p>
00015 <p>
00016         GuidaTV shows off an up-to-date plasma panel TV interface with a 16:9 screen.
00017 </p>
00018 <p>
00019         GuidaTV requires Mac OS X 10.4 "Tiger" or later and an Internet connection (broadband recommended).
00020 </p>
00021 <p>
00022         Suggestion for improvement and new functionality are welcome.
00023         GuidaTV is released as free software, that means you can obtain the sources from the SourceForge.net project page.
00024         If you wish to contribute to its distribution and development, you can make a
00025         <?php print $this->link_to('free donation', array('controller' => 'donate')); ?>.
00026 </p>

00031         </p>
00032         <h3>GuidaTV Cocoa</h3>
00033         <p>
00034                 You should also try the <a href="/software/macosx/guidatv.html">Cocoa version of GuidaTV</a>,
00035                 Universal Binary, with a sleek interface and advanced functionality.
00036         </p>
00037         <p>
00038                 If you&rsquo;re still running Panther, you can still use GuidaTV.
00039         </p>
00040         <p>
00041                 GuidaTV Cocoa requires Mac OS X 10.3 or later.
00042         </p>
00043 </div>
